subject: Programming
title: Kubernetes and Cloud Native
description: A quick, practical guide to Kubernetes and Cloud Native.

hook.text: Google ran billions of containers internally. Then they gave the orchestration system to the world.

buildup.text: Kubernetes launched in 2014 as an open source system for managing containerized applications.

discovery.text: It automated deployment, scaling, and healing of applications across clusters of machines.

twist.text: By open sourcing Kubernetes, Google ensured AWS couldn't monopolize cloud infrastructure.

climax.text: Kubernetes became the standard. Every major cloud provider supports it now.

punchline.text: Google gave away its crown jewel to win the war.

quiz.question: Why did Google open source Kubernetes?
options: To prevent AWS from monopolizing cloud infrastructure
